NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF EDUCATIONAL BROADCASTERS
Station KUOM
University of Minnesota
Minneapolis 14, Minnesota
OFFICE OF THE PRESIDENT
April ?, 1958
Dr. Harry J. Skornia
NAEB Headquarters
14 Gregory Hall
Urbana, Illinois
Dear Harry: ^
Relative to the Smathers Bill:
If the Smathers Bill actually would prohibit a university
which publishes music or sells recordings of musical
compositions from licensing a television station, then we
ought to do something about itâ€”and inform Garrison and
company that we are!
The question is just what should we do? We don't want
to put ourselves in the position of pulling BMI's chestnuts
out of the fire! That, undoubtedly, is what they intended
in bringing this up with Marks.
If the bill as it presently stands actually would
prohibit the University of Michigan from publishing music
and licensing a station, wouldn't it be possible to somehow
amend the bill so as to exclude educational organizations?
This would protect the rights of educational institutions
without embroiling us in the whole to-do between music
publishers and broadcasters.
Only as the last resort, in my opinion, should we
actually oppose the bill as such; this is not basically our
fight; and, we don't want to be pulling the chestnuts out of
the fire for any of the commercial boys. (If this can be
done without appearing to testify, so much the better,
since it is easier and cheaper.)
Yours sincerely,
Burton Paulu
President
BP:ds
p. S. So, would you get in touch with Dobin, and keep me
informed on developments?
